Hi! All

I am a new user of Portable Thunderbird and I would like to seek help 
from fellow users, who are more experienced, to solve a problem.

I think I should explain it first. I usually get my mails by POP using 
Thunderbird installed in my machine (Mine is a Gmail account). But I 
would like to use Portable Thunderbird at the Cybercafe where I usually 
surf the Web. According to the instructions given on the Portable 
Thunderbird website, I copy my profile from my machine into the profile 
folder of Thunderbird in my USB. At Cybercafe, I use the portable exe to 
download my mail by POP while surfing at the same time. When I get back 
to my place, I copy the profile in the USB into my machine again.

The problem is that the amount of my saved mails are daily growing 
larger. It is no problem in the machine but a real problem in the USB.

Is there anyway to remove mails saved in the profile of the Portable 
Thunderbird in my USB, and yet manage to use POP? I neednt keep them there.
Subject: [Portablethunderbird] how to reduce saved mails?

PDT wrote:

 > The problem is that the amount of my saved mails are daily growing
 > larger. It is no problem in the machine but a real problem in the USB.
 >
 > Is there anyway to remove mails saved in the profile of the Portable
 > Thunderbird in my USB, and yet manage to use POP? I neednt keep them
 > there.

PDT,

You have a couple of options.  You can selectively copy over bits of 
your mail store.  If you look inside your profile directory, youll see 
individual directories and files that correspond to your mail folders. 
What you could do is create an Archive folder (for easy identification) 
and keep all your older mail you dont want to take with you inside 
that.  Then, copy all your mail folders over except that one (and 
sub-folders).  Its actually just a big bunch of text files, so you can 
really do what youd like with them.

Also, you should compact your folders on a regular basis to save space. 
  Deleted messages are not removed until you do... even if you empty 
trash.  Just click on any Local Folder and then select FILE and then 
Compact Folders from the main menu.

Regards,
John

Mark,

Thunderbird can only do headers-only or full messages.  It cant just 
take a specific timeframe, I believe.  How to do this is explained on 
the project page.

If your inbox is that large, I would suggest moving some messages to 
other folders on the server.  If you are using POP, youd only be seeing 
the active messages in your inbox.  If you are using IMAP, you can 
selectively subscribe to the inbox folder but not your archive folders.

In short, the answer is to cut down your inbox as a workaround.

Regards,

Are you using IMAP or are you saving locally to the Local Folders?  If 
IMAP, then it may be a server issue and I would recommend removing the 
account from PTB and then re-adding it.  If Local, then perhaps the 
folder is corrupt.  You can delete it from your profile (not from within 
PTB) manually and PTB will recreate it.  Are you using the included 
profile or a local one that you moved into it?  Local profiles are 
currently incompatible and may cause issues like this.

PDT,

You have a couple of options.  You can selectively copy over bits of 
your mail store.  If you look inside your profile directory, youll see 
individual directories and files that correspond to your mail folders. 
What you could do is create an Archive folder (for easy identification) 
and keep all your older mail you dont want to take with you inside 
that.  Then, copy all your mail folders over except that one (and 
sub-folders).  Its actually just a big bunch of text files, so you can 
really do what youd like with them.

Also, you should compact your folders on a regular basis to save space. 
  Deleted messages are not removed until you do... even if you empty 
trash.  Just click on any Local Folder and then select FILE and then 
Compact Folders from the main menu.
